page.title: 11A Pigeon's Tale
page.content: I'm sitting on a beam in the roof of Brighton Station and watching the bustle of human beings trying to catch trains. The smell from "casey Jone's Burgers" is irresistible, no wonder the humans are flocking round buying chips, hamburgers, milkshakes, fish and coke. The ground is covvered in rubbish thrown down by selfish humans. The chatter of annoyed passsengers pushing and shoving, trying to squeeze onto the crowded platform. The ticket collector clips the tickets as the people tramp along. The flower seller shouts to passer_by which adds to the deafening noise. The porters dump mail bags on buggies which shunt along the platforms. The busy, noisy, smelly, station makes an exciting place for any creature, man or pigeon!
